The entities in mass communications we will be
describing are ETV (Educational Television) -
a capability that is community-oriented, and
often, community-based. ER (Educational Radio)-
a mass communications capability with similar
characteristics. As well as ideas for the
establishment of "workable" communications systems
which can help bring the isolated poor closer to
the mainstream of American life.
Further, various sections of this paper will provide
adequate guidelines for Community Action Agencies
to become involved in the mass communications media.
We will indicate here the full range of responsibil¬
ity inherent in any relationship with the mass
communications media, not alone describe the "kinds
of systems" that are applicable. (The responsibility
for creating meaningful "software", which are the
under-pinning of educational broadcasting.) And
lastly, we will be describing those orientational
structures for Community Action Agency staff, with¬
out which much of any effort to relate to mass
communications would be wasteful.
